page.title: 01Braybrooke and Desborough
page.content: The area covered by our survey is mainly open country with woodland confined to a few spinneys.The farms are increasingly concentrating on arable crops with the exception of the fields immediately surrounding Braybrooke which are down to permanent pasture.The 2 farmers concerned still continue the tradition of buying cattle from hill farms mainly in Wales and fattening them for slaughter. The centres of population are the village of Braybrooke and part of the small town of Desborough.The road that connects the 2 was in ancient times the main road to London and the area is crossed by the main railway from London to Derby and the north.To the east of Braybrooke lie the earthworks connected with the Medieval fishponds and the castle of Braybrooke of which there are no upstanding remains.
